title: UNLIMEAT: "It’s the Perfect Time to Enhance the ‘Deliciousness’ of Alternative Meat" - vegconomist - the vegan business magazine
summary: UNLIMEAT, a South Korean company, produces plant-based meat and other food products using upcycled ingredients to reduce food waste. Founded by Keum Chae Min, the company aims to provide convenient and delicious plant-based alternatives, expanding its product offerings while focusing on sustainability. The company has successfully entered the U.S. market, offering diverse K-vegan products and plans for further expansion. UNLIMEAT emphasizes the environmental impact of its innovations while catering to younger consumer preferences for sustainability and variety.
green_innovation: TRUE: This is green innovation because UNLIMEAT uses upcycled materials in its products, actively reducing food waste and contributing to environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE: This is a business innovation as UNLIMEAT has introduced new and improved plant-based food products that differ significantly from traditional meat offerings, responding to a growing market demand.
green_product: TRUE: UNLIMEAT's products meet the definition of a green product as they are designed and manufactured to minimize environmental impact through the use of upcycled ingredients and sustainable practices.
green_process: TRUE: The process of upcycling unused food by-products to create plant-based products qualifies as a green process as it aims to minimize waste and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311 – Food Manufacturing, 311991 – Perishable Prepared Food Manufacturing, 4244 – Grocery and Related Product Merchant Wholesalers, 311999 – All Other Miscellaneous Food Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not suggest greenwashing, as UNLIMEAT transparently emphasizes its commitment to reducing food waste and using upcycled ingredients in its products.

title: Fresh Thyme Market Reveals Inaugural Top Ten Food Trends for 2024 - PR Newswire
summary: Fresh Thyme Market has released its first Trends Report highlighting Midwest shopping behaviors, focusing on emerging product trends and community-driven offerings. The grocer emphasizes a commitment to providing quality fresh food and natural products at affordable prices. The report, based on insights from SPINS Research, reflects the evolving consumer food trends and Fresh Thyme Market's dedication to supporting healthier lifestyles in local communities.
green_innovation: FALSE, the article does not specifically mention any innovations that contribute to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE, the introduction of the Trends Report and the focus on new products reflects a significant improvement in the business process of Fresh Thyme Market.
green_product: FALSE, while the article discusses fresh and natural food products, it does not specify any particular products that meet the green product definition.
green_process: FALSE, there is no mention of specific processes within Fresh Thyme Market that minimize environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 445110 - Grocery Stores, 445120 - Convenience Stores, 311811 - Retail Bakeries, 423450 - Medical, Dental, and Hospital Equipment and Supplies Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE, the article does not appear to make false or misleading claims about environmental benefits but rather emphasizes community focus and natural products.

title: The plastipelago - New Mandala
summary: The article discusses Indonesia's waste crisis and the government's adoption of the circular economy paradigm through the Indonesia Clean from Waste (ICFW) policy, which aims to reduce waste production and promote waste management innovations. It highlights the challenges of waste management, the role of informal waste sectors, and critiques the portrayal of waste as an economic resource without addressing the urgent need for effective waste management systems. The article also points out the adverse effects of certain upcycling practices and stresses the need for social justice in waste management reforms.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article discusses innovations in waste management that aim to reduce environmental impacts and promote sustainability, aligning with green innovation principles.
business_innovation: TRUE - The implementation of waste banks as part of the ICFW policy represents a new business process that significantly differs from previous waste management practices.
green_product: FALSE - While upcycled products are mentioned, they do not consistently meet the definition of a green product due to the adverse environmental effects of their production.
green_process: TRUE - The circular economy strategies and waste bank program are examples of green processes aimed at minimizing waste and promoting sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562920 - Material Recovery Facilities; 812330 - Coin-Operated Laundries and Drycleaners; 423930 - Recyclable Material Merchant Wholesalers; 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services
greenwashing: FALSE - The article presents a critical view of the government's efforts and highlights the challenges and shortcomings of the circular economy initiative rather than promoting misleading claims about environmental benefits.

title: The Employer-Educator Partnership That Can Fill U.S. Jobs - HBR.org Daily
summary: Harvard Business Review (HBR) Learning offers an online leadership training course called Attracting and Cultivating Talent, designed to help individuals enhance their career skills. The course provides more than 40 lessons aimed at helping participants attract, hire, and develop talented employees. Participants can earn badges for accomplishment to share on LinkedIn and resumes. It is a resource trusted by Fortune 500 companies.
green_innovation: FALSE - The article does not discuss a green innovation, as it is focused on leadership training and talent management rather than environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE - The article describes a new online course in leadership training that is significantly different from previous offerings, aimed at improving business processes related to talent management.
green_product: FALSE - There is no mention of a product designed to reduce environmental impact; the focus is on training and development.
green_process: FALSE - The content does not describe any operational method that minimizes environmental impacts or promotes sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 611430 - Professional and Management Development Training, 611699 - All Other Miscellaneous Schools and Instruction, 541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services, 541612 - Human Resources Consulting Services
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not engage in greenwashing, as it does not make any misleading claims about environmental benefits; it is primarily focused on professional development.

title: Brushes with purpose: Kohl Kreatives eyes growth potential among India's eco-conscious beauty consumers - CosmeticsDesign-Asia.com
summary: Kohl Kreatives, a makeup tools brand, has entered the Indian market with products designed for inclusivity and sustainability, responding to a growing demand among younger consumers for eco-friendly options. The founder emphasized the higher costs involved in using upcycled materials and sustainable practices, noting that Indian consumers are becoming more aware of these aspects. The brand maintains a global consumer strategy while planning to enhance local engagement through pop-up events.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the products are designed and manufactured using upcycled materials, which significantly reduces their environmental impact.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the brand has introduced new and improved products specifically tailored to meet the demands of the Indian market, distinguishing them from their previous offerings.
green_product: TRUE, because the makeup brushes and products utilize sustainable materials and processes that minimize environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE, because the production involves the use of upcycled ocean waste plastic, which conserves resources and reduces waste.
product_or_process: makeup brushes and makeup stencil stickers
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 339999 - All Other Miscellaneous Manufactured Goods, 446120 - Cosmetics, Beauty Supplies, and Perfume Stores, 424210 - Drugs and Druggists' Sundries Merchant Wholesalers, 541613 - Marketing Consulting Services
greenwashing: FALSE, because the article presents a transparent and authentic approach to sustainability with no indication of misleading claims about the environmental benefits of the products.
